Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2010 05:30PM - edited Feb 4, 2010 05:37PM by jan1017 I was a Birads 4 after Mammo and Ultras sound. I had core need biopsy which showed ALH/LCIS and the recommendation was excisional biopsy. I had excisonal biopsy and the results were benign. I go for my post op appt on 2-9 so I will get to go over my report and see what if any thing I need to do next. This forum has been a blessing for me. :)
Posts.Title: Birads 5 was benign KCalle74 JoTheGreek

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2010 05:51PM jan1017 wrote: I had an excisonal biopsy in Jan '10 which was B9 Thank God. I have a family history of Colon Cancer in my family(Father and Grandmother(Dad's Mom) and Uncle. I am 58 yrs old and have had 2 Colonoscopies in the last 5 years. Both were negative but I will be having one again in 2015. Personally the "worst" part of the colonoscopy is the prep the day before. The proceudre itself is not bad. I had "twilight sleep" so I son't remember past the meds. :) So don't let the fear of it stop you because the benefit is well worth it. Both my Dad and Grandmother died of colon cancer and my Uncle.  I intend to take advantage of the strides they have made in this medical field. My prayers are with you for good results.  :)
